results.title: Head
results.creator_credit: Bob Rafelson, Jack Nicholson, Columbia and Raybert Productions
results.brief_description: In search for meaning, U.S. sixties band The Monkees roll from one adventure to another in this hilarious plotless movie that manages to sum up the iconography of the day. Through an explosion of images from the sixties, the band bursts through with their silly antics and witty asides on a trajectory to pastiche some of the spirit the pop culture gave birth to in the 20th century. With a cast that includes The Monkees (Peter Tork, David Jones, Mickey Dolenz, Michael Nesmith), Victor Mature, Frank Zappa and Sonny Liston, ‘Head’ manages to turn everything back onto itself.

results.title: On the buses
results.creator_credit: Harry Booth, Ronald Chesney, Ronald Wolfe and Hammer Film Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the successful British comedy television series this feature film version of “On the buses” continues in the same vein with its bawdy humour, one-liners, lecherous males and well-endowed young females (mini-skirts and all). The story line is a bit thin and outdated, but all the familiar characters are still on board (pardon the pun). Bus driver Stan (Reg Varney) and his conductor Jack (Bob Grant) are rather annoyed when Inspector Blakey (Stephen Lewis) decides to put on extra bus drivers. To make matters worse however, the new drivers are not only going to stop Stan from making a bit of extra from working overtime but are female. Prepare yourself for sexist jokes and the stereotypical “butch” women drivers. Stan and Jack’s immediate reaction is to try and sabotage the whole show. However, Inspector Blakey retaliates, and ends up with the last laugh - or does he? Cast also includes Doris Hare, Michael Robbins, Anna Karen.

results.title: The Wisdom of crocodiles = Immortality
results.creator_credit: Po Chih Leong, Carolyn Choa, David Lascelles and Zenith Productions
results.brief_description: The Wisdom of crocodiles, directed by Hong Kong veteran director Po Chih Leong, is an elegant thriller set in contemporary London that combines the serial killer and vampire genres. Steven Grlscz is a charming, wealthy man who lures beautiful women and then subjects them to wicked, deathly pursuits. A sprucely variant of the Dracula myth, “The Wisdom of crocodiles” creates its central character, Grlscz, as a complex individual who lives alone in a gothic, decadent, highly ornamental London ‘pad’ and spends his spare time cataloguing the death of his victims. Grlscz’s killer instinct derives from the Dracula myth tradition: he kills in order to sustain his own well-being and life force. Though evidence points to Grlscz as a suspect, his brilliance outsmarts the police; in fact, Inspector Healey, the Catholic police inspector who tails Grlscz, comes to like and respect him after Grlscz saves his life. Soon enough, they develop a friendship and ruminate on philosophic matters of good and evil, black and white, marriage and fidelity, and so on. Steven’s killer instinct is challenged when he meets structural engineer, Anna Levels, whose combination of femininity and worldliness, sensuality and astuteness, vulnerability and independence, ultimately saves her life. Director Po Chih Leong and writer Paul Hoffman have created a sophisticated, engaging thriller that fits complex characters with gorgeous visuals and an inventive soundtrack. Cast includes Jude Law, Elina Lowensohn, Timothy Spall and Kerry Fox.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Po Chih Leong, Carolyn Choa, David Lascelles and Zenith Productions

results.title: The Man who cried
results.creator_credit: Sally Potter, Christopher Sheppard and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Fegele (Christina Ricci) is a young girl living in a small Russian village with her father who decides to leave for America, promising to send for her as soon as he is able. Nazi troops arrive at the village, forcing Fegele to flee to England with relatives where she is adopted by a loving couple who rename her Suzie. An aspiring and gifted singer, Suzie leaves for Paris where she becomes a nightclub singer and meets Lola (Cate Blanchett). The girls commence work on a lavish opera production where Suzie meets Cesar (Johnny Depp), a poor gypsy horse trainer, and Lola meets Dante (John Turturro), the star of the opera whom she uses for his wealth and security. Suzie and Cesars short lived romance comes to an end with the Nazi occupation of France. Sally Potter, director of ‘The Tango lesson’ and ‘Orlando’ provides a lush and lavish film depicting the heartbreaking world of two souls destined for anguish.

results.title: Mad Dog and Glory
results.creator_credit: John McNaughton, Barbara de Fina, Martin Scorsese and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Robert De Niro and Uma Thurman star as title characters Mad Dog and Glory in this unassuming romantic comedy. A divorced evidence gathering policeman and aspiring photographer, Wayne “Mad Dog” Dobie earns his nickname in reference to his mild mannered nature. One night while on duty Mad Dog inadvertently saves the life of local gangster and part time comedian Frank Milo (a dour Bill Murray, cast against type). Under guidance from his therapist and eager to bring happiness to the life of someone who empathises with his desire to be someone else, Milo befriends Mad Dog and loans Glory (Thurman) to him for a week. Before the week is over Mad Dog and Glory have fallen in love and the two are faced with settling Glory’s brother’s gambling debt to Milo in exchange for their relationship. Cast also includes David Caruso and Mike Star as convincingly menancing sidekick heavyweights and Kathy Baker as Mad Dog’s neighbour.

results.title: The End of the affair
results.creator_credit: Neil Jordan, Stephen Woolley and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: During the Second World War, English novelist Maurice Bendrix (Ralph Fiennes) conducted a five year, illicit affair with a married woman (Julieanne Moore). Embittered and bewildered by his lover’s abrupt disappearance after a bomb attack, Maurice has the opportunity to re-enter Sarah’s life after he encounters her husband Henry (Stephen Rea) shortly after the war. Henry, who maintains a platonic relationship with his wife, suspects that she is having an affair and appeals to Maurice to help him find the truth. Overwhelmed by jealousy, Maurice enlists the services of a private detective on the pretext that he is helping Henry. As the film flashes between the present and the past, the motives for Sarah’s actions are gradually revealed. Graham Greene denied that his novel was based on his own affair with Catherine Walston, despite dedicating it to ‘C’ and giving Sarah’s husband the same name as Catherine’s husband. Cast includes Ian Hart and Jason Isaacs. Music composed and conducted by Michael Nyman. Editing, Tony Lawson. Cinematography, Roger Pratt. Written for the screen by Neil Jordan.

results.title: Cruel intentions
results.creator_credit: Roger Kumble, Neal H. Moritz and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Mercenary manipulator Kathryn, furious at being dumped for the painfully naive Cecile, plots revenge on her ex-boyfriend Court by goading her amoral step-brother Sebastian to seduce her and ruin her reputation. Sebastian is initially reluctant, revealing his interest in a more challenging potential conquest - the headmaster’s daughter Annette, who has vowed in a magazine article to forego sex before marriage. Undeterred, Kathryn proposes a more seductive wager: if Sebastian can successfully seduce Annette before school resumes in the fall, she will give him the one thing he has desperately desired since their parents got married… However, if he fails, then Kathryn gets to keep his most prized possession, a 1956 Jaguar Roadster. With the stakes so high, both of them are determined to win at all costs, leaving a trail of victims in their wake. It is only when their diabolical schemes take a few unexpected turns that they begin to realise the far-reaching consequences of their actions. Cruel Intentions is the fourth film adaptation of Les Liaisons Dangereuses, Choderlos de Laclos’ scandalous 1782 novel that portrayed sexual manipulation as an art form. Stars Sarah Michelle Gellar as Kathryn, Ryan Phillippe as Sebastian, Reese Witherspoon as Annette, and Selma Blair as Cecile.

results.title: Lovers = Amantes
results.creator_credit: Vicente Aranda, Pedro Costa and Television Espanola
results.brief_description: A love triangle set in Franco’s Spain during the 1950’s starring Victoria Abril, Jorge Sanz and Maribel Verdu. After finishing his military service, a provincial young man rents a room in Madrid to be near his fiance. Shortly after moving in, his widowed landlady seduces him into a world of sensual pleasure and petty crime. He becomes her willing accomplice as he is lured away from the conventional life he had planned with his fiance and into a world that defies the values promoted by church and state. As his fiance gradually discovers the depth of his involvement, she makes a pact with him that will ultimately affect everyone’s lives. Screenplay by Alvaro Del Amo, Carlos Perez and Vicente Aranda and based on a true story. Cinematography, Jose Luis Alcaine. Editing, Teresa Font. Music, Jose Nieto. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Carry on constable
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Peter Rogers Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Carry on”.
Fourth in the series of Carry On films, Carry on Constable plays host to the cast of ‘carry-oners’ whose camaraderie as actors made this series so successful. Sergeant Frank Wilkins (Sid James) receives three bumbling new recruits; Constable Charlie Constable (Kenneth Connor) who is plagued by superstitious fears, Constable Stanley Benson (Kenneth Williams) whose scientific deduction distracts him from the task at hand and Constable Tom Potter (Leslie Phillips) whose do-gooder intentions only ever create problems. Tested and exasperated the Sergeant follows the incompetent capers of the Constables into a farcical foray of chaos with much hilarity. Cast also includes: Eric Barker, Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims, Hattie Jacques and Shirley Eaton.

Episode number 4 of Series “Carry on”.
Fourth in the series of Carry On films, Carry on Constable plays host to the cast of ‘carry-oners’ whose camaraderie as actors made this series so successful. Sergeant Frank Wilkins (Sid James) receives three bumbling new recruits; Constable Charlie Constable (Kenneth Connor) who is plagued by superstitious fears, Constable Stanley Benson (Kenneth Williams) whose scientific deduction distracts him from the task at hand and Constable Tom Potter (Leslie Phillips) whose do-gooder intentions only ever create problems. Tested and exasperated the Sergeant follows the incompetent capers of the Constables into a farcical foray of chaos with much hilarity. Cast also includes: Eric Barker, Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims, Hattie Jacques and Shirley Eaton.

results.title: Shadow of a doubt [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock, Jack H. Skirball and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Film noir is here disconcertingly located in the calm world of small town America with young Charlie becoming attached by telepathic bond to her psychopathic uncle Charlie when he comes to visit her family in Santa Rosa. Cast includes Joseph Cotten, Teresa Wright and Macdonald Carey.
